states: metasomal segment one is long and narrow (petiolate), with the rest of the metasoma laterally flattened and disk-like
the entire metasoma is elongate, often with metasomal segment one conical
characters.name: What is the shape of the metasoma?

states: yes, the sheath is barely exerted
no, the sheath is at least as long as half the length of the metasoma
characters.name: Is the ovipositor sheath barely exerted or relatively long?
Does the hind wing have a jugal lobe?

states: yes, the hind tibia is swollen toward the apex, appearing club-shaped
characters.name: Does the hind tibia appear swollen and club-shaped?

states: no, the anterior margin of metasomal segment one is distinctly separated from the metanotum (the height of metasomal tergum one anteriorly is equal to, or less than, the medial length of the propodeum)
characters.name: Does the metasoma attach very close to the metanotum?
